hints.label: thm-ig-hilbert-space
hints.title: IG Hilbert Space Structure
hints.content:
33: :label: thm-ig-hilbert-space
34: 
35: The Information Graph has a well-defined quantum Hilbert space structure:
36: 
37: $$
38: \mathcal{H}_{\text{IG}} = \bigoplus_{N=0}^\infty \mathcal{H}_N
39: $$
40: 
41: where $\mathcal{H}_N = L^2(\mathcal{X}^N \times \mathcal{V}^N) / S_N$ is the symmetric $N$-walker subspace.
42: 
43: **Basis states**: For $N$ walkers at positions/velocities $(x_1, v_1), \ldots, (x_N, v_N)$:
44: 
45: $$
46: |N; x_1, v_1, \ldots, x_N, v_N\rangle \in \mathcal{H}_N
47: $$
48: 
49: **Creation/Annihilation operators**:
50: 
51: $$
52: \hat{\phi}^\dagger(x, v) |N; \{x_i, v_i\}\rangle = |N+1; x, v, \{x_i, v_i\}\rangle
53: $$
54: 
55: $$
56: \hat{\phi}(x, v) |N; \{x_i, v_i\}\rangle = \sqrt{N} \sum_{j=1}^N \delta(x - x_j) \delta(v - v_j) |N-1; \{x_i, v_i\}_{i \neq j}\rangle
57: $$
58: 
59: **Canonical commutation relations**:
60: 
61: $$

47: $$

50: 
51: $$
52: \hat{\phi}^\dagger(x, v) |N; \{x_i, v_i\}\rangle = |N+1; x, v, \{x_i, v_i\}\rangle
53: $$
54: 
55: $$
56: \hat{\phi}(x, v) |N; \{x_i, v_i\}\rangle = \sqrt{N} \sum_{j=1}^N \delta(x - x_j) \delta(v - v_j) |N-1; \{x_i, v_i\}_{i \neq j}\rangle

hints.label: thm-qsd-gibbs
hints.title: QSD is Gibbs State
hints.content:
73: :label: thm-qsd-gibbs
74: 
75: The quasi-stationary distribution (QSD) is an exact thermal equilibrium state for the many-body effective Hamiltonian:
76: 
77: $$
78: H_{\text{eff}}(S) = \sum_{i=1}^N \left( \frac{1}{2}m v_i^2 + U(x_i) \right) + \mathcal{V}_{\text{int}}(S)
79: $$
80: 
81: where $\mathcal{V}_{\text{int}}(S) = -\epsilon_F \sum_{i=1}^N V_{\text{fit}}(x_i, v_i; S)$ is the emergent many-body interaction potential from fitness.
82: 
83: **QSD density operator**:
84: 
85: $$
86: \rho_{\text{QSD}} = \frac{e^{-\beta H_{\text{eff}}}}{Z}
87: $$
88: 
89: where $\beta = 1/T$ is inverse temperature and $Z = \text{Tr}(e^{-\beta H_{\text{eff}}})$ is partition function.
90: 
91: **Detailed balance**: The birth/death rates satisfy:
92: 
93: $$
94: \frac{\Gamma_{\text{death}}(x_i, v_i; S)}{\Gamma_{\text{birth}}(x_i, v_i; S)} = e^{\beta(E_{\text{eff},i}(S) - \mu)}
95: $$
